name: Tax Updates Knowledge Base
description: Recent tax regulation updates and announcements from Indonesian tax authorities (DJP, Ministry of Finance)

taxUpdates.title: New PPh 21 Regulation 2025
taxUpdates.summary: Income tax rates updated for employees. Annual income tax reduced from 25% to 22% for annual income above IDR 500 million. Effective from January 1, 2025.
taxUpdates.details: The Directorate General of Taxation announced new progressive tax rates for PPh 21 (employee income tax). New brackets: 5% (up to IDR 60M annually), 15% (IDR 60M-250M), 22% (IDR 250M-500M), 30% (above IDR 500M). This replaces the previous 25% rate for the third bracket.

taxUpdates.title: VAT Increase to 12%
taxUpdates.summary: Value Added Tax (PPN) will increase from 11% to 12% starting April 1, 2025. Applies to all goods and services subject to VAT.
taxUpdates.details: Following the Tax Law Harmonization (UU HPP), VAT rate increases to 12%. This is part of a gradual increase plan (10% → 11% → 12%). Businesses must update pricing, invoicing systems, and tax reporting by April 1, 2025.

taxUpdates.title: Tax Amnesty Extension
taxUpdates.summary: Tax amnesty program extended until December 31, 2025. Reduced penalties for voluntary disclosure of unreported income and assets.
taxUpdates.details: Program allows taxpayers to report previously undeclared assets and income with reduced penalties. Penalty rates: 6% (domestic assets), 8% (foreign assets repatriated), 11% (foreign assets not repatriated). Available until December 2025.

taxUpdates.title: Carbon Tax Implementation
taxUpdates.summary: Carbon tax of IDR 30 per kg CO2 to be implemented for coal power plants starting July 2025.
taxUpdates.details: Indonesia's first carbon tax targets coal-fired power plants. Rate: IDR 30/kg CO2 equivalent emissions. Covers plants with capacity above 100 MW. Revenue allocated to environmental programs and renewable energy development.

taxUpdates.title: E-Invoicing Mandatory for Large Taxpayers
taxUpdates.summary: E-faktur (electronic invoicing) becomes mandatory for all large taxpayers (turnover > IDR 4.8B) starting March 2025.
taxUpdates.details: All VAT-registered businesses with annual turnover above IDR 4.8 billion must use e-faktur system for all tax invoices. Manual/paper invoices no longer accepted. Integration with DJP's online system required. Penalties for non-compliance: fines up to IDR 1 million per invoice.

taxUpdates.title: Transfer Pricing Documentation Threshold Lowered
taxUpdates.summary: Transfer pricing documentation now required for related party transactions above IDR 20 billion (previously IDR 50 billion).
taxUpdates.details: Lower threshold means more companies must maintain transfer pricing documentation. Applies to: goods/services transactions, loans, royalties, management fees with related parties. Documentation must follow OECD standards. Penalties for non-compliance: up to 200% of tax underpayment.
